Class StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1

  • java.lang.Object

    ServiceClient<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.ProfileV1Client>, Storefront.ProfileClient, java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Enclosing class:
    StorefrontClientV1
    @Immutable
@ThreadSafe
public static final class StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1
extends BaseService<co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.ProfileV1Client>
implements Storefront.ProfileClient
    API client implementing access to the Storefront Profile Service, version 1; the profile service is responsible for fetching and updating user profiles, usernames, avatars, and so forth and is typically consumed by storefront UI implementations.

    The Storefront API, and by extension this Profile API, is a private API service enabling Cookies and close partners to transact online with consumers and businesses. Access to this API requires an bearer token (referred to as an API key) issued by Tech@Cookies, and all methods require an active and unexpired user access token.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1 configure​(SDKConfiguration configuration)
      Configure an instance of the Profile Client facade using the provided SDK configuration suite, including any specified custom endpoint, executor provider, header provider, credential provider, and transport channel provider.
      static StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1 defaults()
      Create an instance of the Profile Client backed entirely with defaults, including a default executor (started with 3 threads at the time of writing), a default header provider applying any API key and authorization settings, an instantiating gRPC transport, and a default empty credential provider.
      com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListeningScheduledExecutorService executorService()
      Return this service's initialized executor service, which typically just proxies to the executor provider mounted on the client facade.
      com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<java.util.Optional<cookies.schema.store.ProfileResponse>> fetch​(AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileRequest> rpc)
      Asynchronously fetch the specified user profile, specified either via their username or their user ID; if the user could not be found, or the invoking user does not have access and the requested user's profile is set to private, return Optional.empty().
      static StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1 forStub​(co.cookies.sdk.storefront.v1.stub.ProfileV1Stub stub)
      Create an instance of the Profile Client backed directly with the provided stub (this is generally useful for testing and in-process or inter-process dispatch).
      com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.model.StoreUser> update​(AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileUpdateRequest> rpc)
      Asynchronously apply the specified update to a user's profile, and then return the updated profile with any requested changes applied; if changes fail to apply because of concurrent mutations (or any other reason), this method will throw an exception.

      Asynchronously check the availability of the provided username; if the decoded response indicates the name is globally available, return `true`, otherwise `false`.

    • Method Detail

      • configure

        @Nonnull
public static StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1 configure​(@Nonnull
                                                           SDKConfiguration configuration)
        Configure an instance of the Profile Client facade using the provided SDK configuration suite, including any specified custom endpoint, executor provider, header provider, credential provider, and transport channel provider.

        When using this interface instead of the builder methods exposed via CookiesSDK.builder(), the developer is required to manage all service state manually. Please see the docs for CookiesSDK for more information about how to acquire a Profile API client easily.

        Parameters:
        configuration - Configuration to use when creating the new facade.
        Returns:
        Instance of the Profile API client facade.

      • defaults

        @Nonnull
public static StorefrontClientV1.ProfileClientV1 defaults()
        Create an instance of the Profile Client backed entirely with defaults, including a default executor (started with 3 threads at the time of writing), a default header provider applying any API key and authorization settings, an instantiating gRPC transport, and a default empty credential provider.
        Returns:
        Profile client facade.

      • fetch

        @Nonnull
public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<java.util.Optional<cookies.schema.store.ProfileResponse>> fetch​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                                          AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileRequest> rpc)
        Description copied from interface: Storefront.ProfileClient
        Asynchronously fetch the specified user profile, specified either via their username or their user ID; if the user could not be found, or the invoking user does not have access and the requested user's profile is set to private, return Optional.empty().

        Requesting a profile with the special username/user ID `me` requests the currently logged-in user's profile. Accessing this special path requires an active and identified user session.

        Specified by:
        fetch in interface Storefront.ProfileClient
        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC which we should submit to fetch a user profile.
        Returns:
        Future which resolves to an Optional containing the requested store user profile, or else Optional.empty() if the profile does not exist, or the invoking user does not have access to see it.
        See Also:
        Synchronous version of this method.

      • update

        @Nonnull
public com.google.common.util.concurrent.ListenableFuture<cookies.schema.store.model.StoreUser> update​(@Nonnull
                                                                                                       AsyncRPC<cookies.schema.store.ProfileUpdateRequest> rpc)
        Description copied from interface: Storefront.ProfileClient
        Asynchronously apply the specified update to a user's profile, and then return the updated profile with any requested changes applied; if changes fail to apply because of concurrent mutations (or any other reason), this method will throw an exception.

        Requests to update user profiles must, of course, be affixed with user authorization which matches the profile under edit.

        Specified by:
        update in interface Storefront.ProfileClient
        Parameters:
        rpc - RPC which we should submit to edit the current user's profile.
        Returns:
        Future which resolves to the updated user profile, with any requested changes applied.
        See Also:
        Synchronous version of this method.
